result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Silva was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesus Silva is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesus Silva was found guilty of Violation of the 100 ft. setback requirements for animal structures. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Jesus Silva was found guilty of Violation of the 100 ft. setback requirements for animal structures. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Jesus Silva was found guilty of Accumulation of waste on land. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Silva

records.addlTxt: DE appeared.  DE to pay $40/mo comm 3-01-18.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA.  jaf

DE's atty, David Sienko appeared re: Order for Pymt.  DE inquired about the DE getting an ext.  David was advised that the DE has an appt to meet w/me tomrw to sign a Pymt Plan.  I inquired if there would be too much of a language barrier & David was unsure if the DE would comprehend without an interpreter.  I advised David that if the DE did not want to meet w/me in person tomrw, he/they may draft a request in writing & submit it by 4:30 pm on 3-02-18.  David stated he would either help the DE draft a request or appear w/him at his Pymt Plan appt tomrw & would call & verify.  jaf
**David Sienko left a v/m at 3:18 pm stating he will appear w/the DE at the DE's appt tomrw.  jaf

From DE's sister-in-law re: unpd bal.  Ret'd call to the DE's SIL & advised her that the bal is still $350 & was due today as advised last wk.  She inquired about a Pymt Plan & was advised that the DE may request a Pymt Plan in writing or set up an appt to meet w/me.  She scheduled the appt for tomrw & will call back to verify that the DE can make it.  I inquired about the DE needing an interpreter & was advised that he should be able to set up the Pymt Plan without one.  jaf
**Linda called back & confirmed that the DE will appear at 1:15 pm tomrw.  jaf
From DE's sister in law requesting a final bal.  DE's SIL called again & was given a bal of $350 & was advised that the bal is due in full by 2-26-18.  jaf
Order for payment on February 26, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
EFV signed 12/1/17. eif

Court will review in 30 days and set Court date if stipulation is not filed. DA Nieskes states Day Report Center reporting is not needed. Court does not impose Day Report Center requirement. Interpreter Sworn. ADA Nieskes updates the court. Atty Silva will be filing Motions. Parties to contact JA on 10/19/2016 at 11:00 am for a telephone Conference to schedule next hearing. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Atty Sienko requests bond modification. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Court does not believe the bond needs to be modified. CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  David Leon Sienko   DF:  Jesus Silva appeared with Interpreter M. Marin. T. Silva also appears pro se. Includes ARGN and 15CF534 and STC on 15CF535. Case called at 4:19 pm. Interpeter Sworn. On 15CF535, Court reviews file. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Court questions T. Silva. She does not wish to hire an Attorney. Court sets another hearing. On 15CF534, an Information was filed. Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. NG on all counts. Waive Speedy. Address confirmed. Bond continues. ADA Nieskes makes statement. km  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.
#1 O/R. km
Arraignment on August 23, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Evenson, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: David Leon Sienko for DF: Jesus Silva appeared. DF ATTY: Sherlene Perrin for DF: Teresa Silva. Court Interpreter Mariana Kralewski. Case called at 10:08. Includes 15CF534,15CF535. S/T Court Interpreter M. Kralewski. Atty. Perrin updates the court and would like to withdraw. DE T. Silva responds. ADA Nieskes responds. ADA Nieskes suggests proceeding with Mr. Silva's preliminary hearing. Atty. Sienko responds. Court reviews Ms. Silva's rights to an Atty. Ms. Silva understands and would like to represent herself. DE understands that she will not be able to have a preliminary hearing. Court allows Atty. Perrin to withdraw. On 15CF534 S/T D. Fayerweather. Direct by ADA Nieskes. Investigator Fayerweather identifies the DE J. Silva in court. Ex. #1 report on the chickens from the DR. O/R. Cross by Atty. Sienko. Atty. Sienko argues  and sites 951.08(2). ADA Nieskes argues. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bonds continue. Court finds good cause not to have the prelim on 15CF535.  Arraignment scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Evenson, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: David Leon Sienko DF ATTY: Shirlene Perrin DF:  Jesus Silva appeared DF: Teresa Silva appeared and interpreter Monica Marin appears. Case called at  3:03. Includes 15CF534, 15CF535. Oath of Interpreter given to Monica Marin. ADA Nieskes updates the court. Ms. Silva's matter can be resolved and requests a preliminary hearing date. ADA Nieskes requests a prelimninary haring for both matters. Bonds continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  David Leon Sienko, DF:  Teresa Ann Silva appeared for 15CF535. Court reviews case and question remains re: Atty for Teresa Silva. More time is requested to determine status of Atty for DE Teresa Silva. Court sets a new date. Bonds continue.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  David Leon Sienko   DF:  Jesus Silva appeared and Teresa Silva. Interpreter M. Marin also present.  Case called at 10:35 am. Interpreter Sworn. Court reviews file. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Officer is unavailable at this time. Atty Sienko makes statement. There is on a Motion re: conflict of interest of Atty Sienko and representation of the co-defendant's. Parties sworn. S/T R. Silva. Direct by Atty Sienko. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Court questions. S/T J. Silva. Direct by Atty Sienko. Recess. Case recalled at 11:09 am. Case recalled at 11:10 am. S/T J. Silva. Direct by Atty Sienko. Court will need to letter re: waiver. records.addlTxt: Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: David Leon Sienko DF: Teresa Ann Silva appeared and Jesus Silva appeared. Interpreter Monica Marin appeared. Case called at  Includes 15CF534 Teresa Silva and 15CF535 Jesus Silva. Case called at 2:58. Court interpreter Monica Marin sworn. Court reviews file. On 15CF535 Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waives speedy trial. Atty. Sienko updates the court and files paperwork that initially was filed premature but now timely. Court will have this matter administratively assigned to another branch in St. Croix County. Atty's to get info to DCA to have case reassigned. Once reassigned the JA will do scheduling with Atty's. PH on 04-28-2016 will be canc.

Status conference at 04-25-2016 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 04-28-2016 11:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: David Leon Sienko DF: Jesus Silva appeared. Interpreter Monica Marin appeared. Ms. Silva is not in court. Case called at 10:35. Includes 15CF534 and now joined with 15CF535. Scheduled for a preliminary hearing. Oath of Interpreter given to Ms. Marin. Court reviews file and off record discussions with Atty's. Mr. Silva is prepared to waive. Ms. Silva is not present to waive. Court will reschedule preliminary hearing when both parties are present. Bond continues in form and amount. Atty. Sienko addresses a substitution of judge. Court QUASHES warrant on Ms. Silva at this time but will leave the authorization in place at this time.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 02:45 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.
